title: H.C. Wainwright maintains Neutral on Mawson Infrastructure stock amid recovery efforts By Investing
description: H.C. Wainwright maintains Neutral on Mawson Infrastructure stock amid recovery efforts
content:
Investing.com - H.C. Wainwright has reiterated its Neutral rating on Mawson Infrastructure Group Inc. (NASDAQ: ) following the company’s second-quarter 2025 financial results, which showed sequential revenue decline. According to InvestingPro data, the company’s overall financial health score stands at 1.5, indicating a weak position, with revenue declining 11.36% over the last twelve months.

Mawson reported Q2 revenue of $9.5 million, down from $13.8 million in the first quarter, primarily due to Consensus Technology Group’s withdrawal of miners from the company’s Midland, Pennsylvania facility in April, which negatively impacted co-location revenue. The company’s market capitalization currently stands at $8.73 million, with a beta of 3.9 indicating high stock price volatility.

The company’s energy management revenue increased to $5.1 million from $3.1 million in the previous quarter, while self-mining revenue rose to $0.7 million from $0.3 million, partially offsetting the co-location revenue decline.

Mawson’s near-term recovery strategy centers on executing its 64MW, three-year co-location agreement with Canaan, which the research firm views as the most direct path to restoring contracted revenue, while the company’s flagship 120MW Midland site remains approximately 70% utilized.

The appointment of a new interim CEO in June could help resolve legal issues more quickly, according to H.C. Wainwright, which remains on the sidelines until positive milestones in legal settlements clear existing overhangs.

In other recent news, Mawson Infrastructure Group announced the termination of Rahul Mewawalla as Chief Executive Officer and President, effective July 8. The company stated that the termination was for cause, as outlined in Mewawalla’s employment agreement. Following his departure, Mewawalla was required to forfeit 4,548,512 unvested restricted stock units. Additionally, the board of directors requested that Mewawalla resign from his position on the board, which he was deemed to have done immediately. These developments mark a significant change in the company’s leadership. The termination and subsequent legal actions are part of ongoing internal adjustments. The company did not provide further details on the reasons behind these decisions.

This article was generated with the support of AI and reviewed by an editor. For more information see our T&C.

shortSummary: H.C.Wainwright maintains a Neutral rating on Mawson Infrastructure Group amid declining revenue and leadership changes, with near-term recovery expected.
argos_summary: H.C. Wainwright has maintained a Neutral rating on Mawson Infrastructure Group Inc. following a decline in Q2 2025 revenue to $9.5 million, down from $13.8 million in Q1, largely due to the withdrawal of miners by Consensus Technology Group. The company's financial health score is low at 1.5, with an 11.36% revenue decline over the past year. Mawson's energy management and self-mining revenues increased, but overall recovery strategies hinge on a new co-location agreement and leadership changes, including the termination of CEO Rahul Mewawalla.
